last_episode_to_air.name: Viki's New Shop
last_episode_to_air.overview: Drew and Viki buy for Viki's new Edinburgh premises and they find deer antlers from a Cumbrian country house and industrial tables from a former tannery.

name: Salvage Hunters

next_episode_to_air.name: Curated Collections
next_episode_to_air.overview: Drew and Al trawl collections curated by experts unearthing a rare item of motoring history and a 19th-century model ship with a tale to tell.

overview: Meet modern-day treasure hunter Drew Pritchard. With demanding customers, high turnover, and one of the biggest decorative salvage yards in the UK, Drew is constantly on the road, crisscrossing the country in search of derelict gems and forgotten remnants. Drew loves the thrill of the hunt and while he gets his hands dirty in the country's architectural backwaters, his crack team of restorers is back at the shop giving old and rare finds a new lease on life.

episodes.name: Episode 1
episodes.overview: Drew Pritchard searches the UK for valuable scrap items. A set of rare vehicles is less exciting than he had hoped, but a trip to Coventry is surprisingly profitable

episodes.name: Episode 2
episodes.overview: Drew Pritchard explores a travelling vintage funfair, a Windsor pub where everything is for sale, and an illuminations depot in Blackpool that is filled with pop art

episodes.name: Episode 3
episodes.overview: Drew Pritchard searches for new items to restock his shop. He finds a wealth of industrial fixtures at a former air force base, and visits a warehouse in Brighton

episodes.name: Episode 4
episodes.overview: Drew Pritchard hits the road to find more stock, and finds a yard filled with interesting pieces. He also visits an inventor in Battle, whose collection includes a mummified cat

episodes.name: Episode 5
episodes.overview: Drew Pritchard enlists the help of seasoned hoarders, including one who collects cement mixers

episodes.name: Episode 6
episodes.overview: Drew Pritchard searches the sheds of a stately home for potentially valuable items, while Julian road-tests a tank

episodes.name: Episode 7
episodes.overview: Drew gets stranded in Somerset following a late cancellation, and the owner of Tissington Hall in Derbyshire organises a large-scale house clearance

episodes.name: Episode 8
episodes.overview: Drew and Julian discover some desirable collectibles at an aeroplane scrapyard, but think the items may be overpriced. The duo also visit an unusual manor house

episodes.name: Episode 9
episodes.overview: Drew Pritchard purchases some medieval shields while examining a collection of costumes and period weaponry - and then also considers buying a Land Rover he has spotted in a shed

episodes.name: Episode 10
episodes.overview: Drew Pritchard visits the Great Fulford estate in Devon in search of valuable scrap items

episodes.name: Episode 1
episodes.overview: Drew barters with a baronet and is given a run for his money by a seasoned salvager. Plus, can he make a profit on a collection of late 19th century balconet rails?

episodes.name: Episode 2
episodes.overview: Drew Pritchard continues his search for valuable scrap items in Scotland, where he bargains for a Victorian canopy and examines goods in a boxer's back garden. He also hopes to make a profit from a collection of opaline lights

episodes.name: Episode 3
episodes.overview: Drew Pritchard continues his search for valuable scrap items in the UK, visiting an antique dealer whose stock includes a lamp that could make his entire trip worthwhile. He also searches for treasures in a Somerset estate's coach house

episodes.name: Episode 4
episodes.overview: Examining a treasure trove of strange salvage and quirky antiques; a beachside bounty includes vintage skateboards and surfboards.

episodes.name: Episode 5
episodes.overview: Drew and Tee fly to Norway; although concerned the prices may be out of reach, Drew seals his first Norwegian deal at an old sawmill turned gallery.

episodes.name: Episode 6
episodes.overview: The boys realise they have to fill up the van or the trip will make a loss, and they head to a Bergen salvage yard in the hopes of finding some useful items

episodes.name: Episode 7
episodes.overview: Drew uncovers plenty of rare items at a Welsh country house; scouring a one-man salvage operation near Coventry.

episodes.name: Episode 8
episodes.overview: Drew Pritchard haggles with a headteacher, squeezes into a hoarder's shed and takes a tour of a grand country house as he searches for more saleable items.

episodes.name: Episode 9
episodes.overview: Drew Pritchard hunts for valuable items on an old family estate, steps back in time at a 1920s-themed hotel, and uncovers tiny treasures at an antiques wholesaler

episodes.name: Episode 10
episodes.overview: Drew Pritchard discovers treasures in an Oxfordshire brewery, and drives a hard bargain with a fairground fanatic in Essex

episodes.name: Episode 1
episodes.overview: Drew is captivated by Hesleyside Hall, a Northumbrian country house full of potential salvaging gold. But will its owners prove a match for the canny salvager?

episodes.name: Episode 2
episodes.overview: Meet modern-day treasure hunter Drew Pritchard. With demanding customers, high turnover, and one of the biggest decorative salvage yards in the UK, what will he come across today?

episodes.name: Episode 3
episodes.overview: Drew’s auction goes awry due to a sudden onset of wintry weather, while he also has a hard task persuading one reluctant trader to sell. Finally, he tours a haunted house.

episodes.name: Episode 4
episodes.overview: Meet modern-day treasure hunter Drew Pritchard. With demanding customers, high turnover, and one of the biggest decorative salvage yards in the UK, what will he come across today?

episodes.name: Episode 5
episodes.overview: Ace salvager Drew Pritchard is always on the lookout for stock for his show room. Today he deals with a baronet who drives a hard bargain and meets a fellow enthusiast in Surrey.

episodes.name: Episode 6
episodes.overview: Ace salvager Drew Pritchard is always on the lookout for stock for his show room. Today, it’s full steam ahead at Trinity Marine in Devon, but it’s not all plain sailing.

episodes.name: Episode 7
episodes.overview: Drew and Tee look for potentially lucrative leads at a Catholic girls' school in Worcestershire; a visit to a Welsh prop hire firm.

episodes.name: Episode 8
episodes.overview: Ace salvager Drew Pritchard is always on the lookout for stock for his show room. Today he visits an imposing Gothic castle in Ireland, but is there anything to buy?

episodes.name: Episode 9
episodes.overview: Ace salvager Drew Pritchard is always on the lookout for stock for his show room. But which potential treasures will he come across today?

episodes.name: Episode 1
episodes.overview: Drew and Tee visit The Yew Tree Inn of Cauldon; Walcot Hall in Lydbury North; Kevin Marshall's Antique Warehouse in Hull

episodes.name: Episode 2
episodes.overview: Drew and Tee visit Batemans Brewery in Wainfleet; a 16th century Elizabethan mansion in Doddington; Bridale Architectural Antiques in Cradley Heath

episodes.name: Episode 3
episodes.overview: Drew and Tee visit Wookey Hole near Somerset;

episodes.name: Episode 4
episodes.overview: Drew and Tee visit Forde Abbey in Chard; The Mill Toy and Pedal Car Museum in Northiam; Father/son antique shops in Margate

episodes.name: Episode 5
episodes.overview: Drew and Tee visit the Anstey Hall in Cambridge; Patrick Reclaims & Builders Merchants in Wisbech; Odeon Antiques & Interiors in Leek; Apley Estate in Bridgnorth

episodes.name: Episode 6
episodes.overview: Drew and Tee visit Askham Hall in Cumbria; Stewart Imber in Hertfordshire; Caudwell's Mill in Matlock

episodes.name: Episode 7
episodes.overview: At a remote salvage yard near Bournemouth, modern-day treasure hunter Drew Pritchard is drawn to a bathing beauty. Later, he visits an exclusive B&B in Yorkshire.

episodes.name: Episode 8
episodes.overview:
Drew and Tee visit Jacksons Corner in Reading; 

Borde Hill Garden in Haywards Heath; Neville Griffiths in Lower Weedon

episodes.name: Episode 9
episodes.overview: Drew and Tee visit the Portico Library in Manchester; Bygone Times in Chorley; Daleside Reclamation in Bedale; Meldon Village in Morpeth

episodes.name: Episode 10
episodes.overview: Drew and Tee revisit Carter's Steam Fair in Maidenhead; Fern Avenue Antique Centre and Interiors in Newcastle Upon Tyne; Viking Reclamation in Doncaster

episodes.name: Episode 3
episodes.overview: Drew visits Britain’s biggest private home where he is stumped on negotiations, finds some cool head carvings and discovers the actual tartan of Elvis Presley.

episodes.name: Episode 4
episodes.overview: Drew heads to Derbyshire where a props business is home to a slew of oversize industrial antiques and a few must-have gems. Later, a salvage yard features some amazing finds.

episodes.name: Episode 5
episodes.overview: Modern-day treasure hunter Drew Pritchard is constantly on the road to salvage derelict gems and forgotten remnants to restore and sell on for a healthy profit.

episodes.name: Episode 6
episodes.overview: Modern-day treasure hunter Drew Pritchard is constantly on the road to salvage derelict gems and forgotten remnants to restore and sell on for a healthy profit.

episodes.name: Episode 7
episodes.overview: Modern-day treasure hunter Drew Pritchard is constantly on the road to salvage derelict gems and forgotten remnants to restore and sell on for a healthy profit.

episodes.name: Episode 8
episodes.overview: Modern-day treasure hunter Drew Pritchard is constantly on the road to salvage derelict gems and forgotten remnants to restore and sell on for a healthy profit.

episodes.name: Episode 9
episodes.overview: Modern-day treasure hunter Drew Pritchard is constantly on the road to salvage derelict gems and forgotten remnants to restore and sell on for a healthy profit.

episodes.name: Episode 10
episodes.overview: Modern-day treasure hunter Drew Pritchard is constantly on the road to salvage derelict gems and forgotten remnants to restore and sell on for a healthy profit.

episodes.name: Episode 1
episodes.overview: Architectural salvage expert, Drew Pritchard, visits a grand private school with a cellar full of furniture. Then it’s off to Glastonbury reclamation on a hunt for new stock.

episodes.name: Episode 2
episodes.overview: Drew Pritchard meets a stylish shop dealer, and visits a site that is piled high with antiques

episodes.name: Episode 3
episodes.overview: Drew visits an old manor house in Wales and discovers a beautiful forgotten treasure in an attic. At a reclamation yard in Norfolk, he gets a taste for some striking street art.

episodes.name: Episode 4
episodes.overview: Drew gets to live out every schoolboy's dream, driving a 1940s steam engine. Then, he visits a country house where there's hundreds of year worth of junk to trawl for gems.

episodes.name: Episode 5
episodes.overview: Drew travels to Woodlands castle in Somerset and falls in love with some vintage toys. In Lincolnshire, he visits a reclamation yard that buys low and sells even lower.

episodes.name: Episode 6
episodes.overview: Drew heads to Penzance in Cornwall where he battles with a dealer who doesn‚Äôt like to let go of his stock. And in Norfolk, he has an enchanting tour through a museum of magic.

episodes.name: Episode 7
episodes.overview: Drew is hoping to find some unwanted treasures as he and Tee travel to a steam museum in Norfolk. In Hereford, Drew has been given privileged access to a collection.

episodes.name: Episode 8
episodes.overview: Architectural Salvage expert Drew Pritchard is let loose in one of the biggest locations he's ever visited - a sprawling Victorian wool mill in Bradford.

episodes.name: Episode 9
episodes.overview: Drew travels to the magnificent Bamburgh Castle, perched high on the Northumberland coast. Will its impressive contents entice him?

episodes.name: Episode 10
episodes.overview: Salvage supremo Drew Pritchard visits a historic hop farm in Kent, and discovers some unexpected finds amongst the cobwebs. Plus, he'll get a touch of Hollywood glamour.

episodes.name: Episode 1
episodes.overview: Drew visits one of his favourite ever houses and discovers a design classic. Later, he visits a museum in a giant windmill, will it be a wasted trip or will he be blown away?

episodes.name: Episode 2
episodes.overview: Drew Pritchard heads to a manor house in Oxfordshire, where the classic exterior hides a weird and wonderful interior in which he hopes to uncover some priceless gems.

episodes.name: Episode 3
episodes.overview: Drew heads to an antiques shop in Edinburgh on a hunt for new stock and on an expedition to a 750-year-old house, he discovers an item that takes him out of his comfort zone.

episodes.name: Episode 4
episodes.overview: When architectural salvage hunter Drew Pritchard, and his sidekick Tee, get access to a recently-closed department store, he faces a potentially almighty shopping spree.

episodes.name: Episode 5
episodes.overview: Top salvage expert Drew Pritchard breaks new ground with his first ever buying trip to Northern Ireland, where he gets trollied and falls for a vintage Japanese beauty.

episodes.name: Episode 6
episodes.overview: Architectural salvage expert Drew visits a stately home in Barnstaple, where he tries to charm Lady Arran. Then he finds plenty of neon treats in Bournemouth.

episodes.name: Episode 7
episodes.overview: The salvaging extraordinaire does battle at a castle in Essex, an antiques emporium in Berkshire holds anatomical interest and Drew drives a hard bargain on automobile memorabilia.

episodes.name: Episode 8
episodes.overview: Drew Pritchard and sidekick Tee are on a buying trip in Germany. They trade with Counts and Barons and meet characters as quirky as the antiques they’re potentially selling.

episodes.name: Episode 9
episodes.overview: Salvage expert Drew Pritchard is in Wirral visiting a stately home that doubles as an antique shop. But with so much on offer will it cost him the earth?

episodes.name: Episode 10
episodes.overview: Drew visits a Victorian folly in Devon where his ghoulish purchases shock his wife. Plus, the premium prices at a high-end antique emporium in London threaten to cause a stink.

episodes.name: Episode 1
episodes.overview: Architectural salvage expert Drew Pritchard returns to track down more valuable items, beginning at a Scottish castle, where he test-drives a historic million-pound car

episodes.name: Episode 2
episodes.overview: Drew Pritchard searches for items worthy of restoration at the former Naval Royal Hospital School in Suffolk, where he learns a few lessons while trying to negotiate a deal

episodes.name: Episode 3
episodes.overview: Salvage supremo Drew Pritchard is spoiled for choice at a dealership in Henley and tries to score a win against the house at a bingo hall.

episodes.name: Episode 4
episodes.overview: Drew Pritchard visits a new antiques centre in Shropshire, and with almost 50 traders to choose from, he soon finds some bargains, including a selection of unusual items.

episodes.name: Episode 5
episodes.overview: Drew fills up his van with deals from a heritage railway station in Yorkshire. Meanwhile, he has to go in at the right price for a rare item he has never come across before.

episodes.name: Episode 6
episodes.overview: Drew Pritchard visits a North London store full of antique shop-fittings, and then heads to a Second World War hospital museum in Suffolk.

episodes.name: Episode 7
episodes.overview: Drew Pritchard heads to the Malvern Hills, where he unearths one of his most unusual finds. Plus, he visits a famed stone mason's in Liverpool to examine rare artisan carvings.

episodes.name: Episode 8
episodes.overview: Salvager Drew Pritchard explores a Napoleonic fort in Essex, and tours the medieval Lichfield Cathedral, where he checks out some unwanted objects.

episodes.name: Episode 9
episodes.overview: Drew visits a sign writer’s in Portsmouth finds one of his favourite ever objects. Meanwhile in Southend-on-Sea, petrol head Drew gets revved up at a Porsche restorers.

episodes.name: Episode 10
episodes.overview: Salvage guru Drew finds nirvana with a Winchester pub full of quirky antiques. In Hampshire he makes a controversial purchase and he’s surprised by a vintage boutique in Suffolk.

episodes.name: Shilstone
episodes.overview: Drew gets carried away at a Devon mansion and takes home the worst chair he's ever bought. Later at a lace factory in Scotland, he literally goes home with the kitchen sink.

episodes.name: Pepper Arden
episodes.overview: Drew is blown away by a breathtaking 18th-century mansion on the edge of the Yorkshire Moors, and goes deep below ground at a Liverpool cathedral to unearth religious artifacts.

episodes.name: Leominster
episodes.overview: Drew is in Leominster where he sees an incredible private garden, and shows his metal at one of the country’s last Brass Foundries, taking a chance on some unique containers.

episodes.name: Episode 4
episodes.overview: Drew heads to a Kent antiques emporium specialising in unusual European antiques, and indulges in 1940s nostalgia at a home front museum in South West Wales.

episodes.name: Episode 5
episodes.overview: Drew goes North of the border on a road trip for an epic private house clearance in a remote part of Scotland, and he visits a historic cutlery factory in Sheffield.

episodes.name: Episode 6
episodes.overview: Drew visits a hip dealer in Manchester, haggles with a windmill manager in Kent and seeks artifact redemption at a Somerset abbey. Plus, he moves shop after 10 years in one place.

episodes.name: Episode 7
episodes.overview: Drew is in the north of Scotland to see a Victorian theatre in Aberdeen and the remote town of Rothes. Plus, sidekick Tee shows him how to do a deal at a steam railway in Devon.

episodes.name: Episode 8
episodes.overview: Drew picks up a wild-looking Victorian oil lamp and a stunning old American sign in London. Plus, he meets an Oxfordshire aristocrat with a steam train in his private collection!

episodes.name: Episode 9
episodes.overview: Drew is in London to haggle for a macabre collection of medical antiques. In Nottinghamshire, he visits a warehouse full of vintage Americana and he heads to a grand Scottish home.

episodes.name: Episode 10
episodes.overview: Drew haggles with a dealer at an Elizabethan manor house, is blown away by a jet engine in a Welsh museum, and meets an old friend in Sheffield – finding a modern treasure.

episodes.name: Episode 11
episodes.overview: In Tyne and Wear Drew tries to meet the expectations of a customer with a taste for mid-century chic. Plus he is enchanted by a former friary where a rare mirror catches his eye.

episodes.name: Episode 12
episodes.overview: Modern day treasure hunter Drew Pritchard travels the length and breadth of the country in search of weird and wonderful objects. The bigger the hoard, the happier he is.

episodes.name: Episode 13
episodes.overview: Modern day treasure hunter Drew Pritchard travels the length and breadth of the country in search of weird and wonderful objects. The bigger the hoard, the happier he is.

episodes.name: Episode 14
episodes.overview: In London Drew visits a fledgling antiques business run by an enterprising young couple. Plus, he faces some punishing negotiations at a living history museum in Surrey.

episodes.name: Episode 15
episodes.overview: Drew gets a scoop when he delves into the history and mechanics of print in London's Fleet Street. And, in Devon, he indulges hi passion for architectural salvage.

episodes.name: Episode 1
episodes.overview: Drew finds a mysterious piece of black pottery in Lancashire, finds an exotic piece in a zoo in East Anglia and fiercely haggles with an old foe in a nearby salvage yard.

episodes.name: Episode 2
episodes.overview: Drew is at country house sale in Norfolk, and in Glasgow he finds a unique tartan piece at a classic tailor’s. Plus, he finds his oddest buy ever in Liverpool .

episodes.name: Episode 3
episodes.overview: Modern day treasure hunter Drew Pritchard travels the length and breadth of the country in search of weird and wonderful objects. The bigger the hoard, the happier he is.

episodes.name: Episode 4
episodes.overview: Modern day treasure hunter Drew Pritchard travels the length and breadth of the country in search of weird and wonderful objects. The bigger the hoard, the happier he is.

episodes.name: Episode 5
episodes.overview: Modern day treasure hunter Drew Pritchard travels the length and breadth of the country in search of weird and wonderful objects. The bigger the hoard, the happier he is.

episodes.name: Episode 7
episodes.overview: Modern day treasure hunter Drew Pritchard travels the length and breadth of the country in search of weird and wonderful objects. The bigger the hoard, the happier he is.

episodes.name: Episode 8
episodes.overview: Modern day treasure hunter Drew Pritchard travels the length and breadth of the country in search of weird and wonderful objects. The bigger the hoard, the happier he is.

episodes.name: Episode 11
episodes.overview: At a luxury fabric manufacturer in Suffolk, Drew is wowed by historic silks once used in the royal household. And at a castle in Scotland, he haggles with a young baron.

episodes.name: Episode 12
episodes.overview: At a Catholic church in Liverpool, Drew’s prayers are answered with a pair of very rare chairs. In Loughborough, he finds industrial gems in the world’s largest bell foundry.

episodes.name: E01: Quality Always Shines Through
episodes.overview: Drew’s on a mission for quality, heading to a decorative antiques dealer in Tunbridge. In Dumfries, he seeks hidden treasure in a furniture collection.

episodes.name: E02: France
episodes.overview: Modern day treasure hunter Drew Pritchard travels the length and breadth of the country in search of weird and wonderful objects. The bigger the hoard, the happier he is.

episodes.name: E03: Unusual Objects
episodes.overview: Drew is on the hunt for rare objects in a Devizes dealership inside a pub. And, in Leigh-On-Sea, he finds an array of unusual objects salvaged from building sites.

episodes.name: E04: Right Price
episodes.overview: In Margate, Drew snaps up a good deal at a 'junk emporium' run by some of his best contacts. And, at a Georgian mansion in Fife he finds a surprising bargain..

episodes.name: E05: New Business
episodes.overview: Modern day treasure hunter Drew Pritchard travels the length and breadth of the country in search of weird and wonderful objects. The bigger the hoard, the happier he is.

episodes.name: E06: Best Sellers
episodes.overview: Drew heads to Edinburgh, where he discovers an antique shop with a deluxe 1940s American bike. Later, he finds a mid-century designer desk in Wookey Hole.

episodes.name: E07: No Stone Unturned
episodes.overview: Modern day treasure hunter Drew Pritchard travels the length and breadth of the country in search of weird and wonderful objects. The bigger the hoard, the happier he is.

episodes.name: E08: Family
episodes.overview: Drew Pritchard bargains hard in Frome, Somerset, then in Dumfriesshire visits an estate that has been in the same family for several generations and is full of fascinating antiques

episodes.name: E09: History And Provenance
episodes.overview: At a 13th century manor house in Yorkshire, Drew uncovers a wartime flag with a medical history. Plus, he visits a neo-gothic cathedral in Edinburgh.

episodes.name: E10: Clearances
episodes.overview: Drew visits a dealer specialising in house clearances and in Sheffield, he spots industrial furniture at a 19th century factory. Later, he finds old punk collectables.

episodes.name: E11: Treasure Hunt
episodes.overview: At an antiques centre in Gloucestershire, Drew finds a valuable item overlooked by the rest of the trade. Later, he digs out lost treasures on a Kent country estate.

episodes.name: E12: Eccentric People
episodes.overview: In the Lake District, Drew meets an alpaca keeper and antiques collector fond of the unusual. And, at a Staffordshire castle, he meets an Elizabeth I lookalike.

episodes.name: E01: Cotswolds
episodes.overview: Drew finally opens his own antiques shop in his home town of Conwy. So, he goes to the Cotswolds and one of the UK's largest indoor antiques, looking for treasure.

episodes.name: E02: Back To Basics
episodes.overview: With his new shop opening to the public, Drew needs more stock than ever. He spots a '60s Danish sofa in Malvern and a pair of tapestries in Welshpool.

episodes.name: E03: The X Factor
episodes.overview: Drew seeks standout items to lure more customers to his shop. In Derbyshire, he finds a Regency picture frame, and buys a pair of Danish rattan chairs in Harrogate.

episodes.name: E04: When Opportunity Knocks
episodes.overview: Drew is always hunting undiscovered treasures. He has a rare chance to scour the wild items at Chester Zoo. And in Leicestershire, he unearths a royal relic.

episodes.name: E05: Taking Risks
episodes.overview: Drew's business has expanded so he needs twice as many items! He visits a quirky house in Suffolk, to discover a barn full of salvage from around the globe.

episodes.name: E06: Moving With The Times
episodes.overview: When other businesses move with the times, Drew sees a chance to buy their unwanted stuff. In Essex, he finds a rare 1930s desk from a closing department store.

episodes.name: E07: Belgium
episodes.overview: Drew is in Belgium on a continental buying adventure. He visits the flea market in Tongeren and meets a renowned dealer who lives in a huge chateau.

episodes.name: E08: Holland
episodes.overview: Drew heads to Holland where, thanks to its thriving antiques markets, he can find the kind of unique pieces he’s renowned for – including his dream car, a vintage Bugatti.

episodes.name: E09: Episode 9
episodes.overview: Drew unearths a steel corpus of Christ on the cross, and spots a divine early 19th century gothic pew. Later, he finds a set of 1950s industrial pendant lamps.

episodes.name: E10: Episode 10
episodes.overview: In Gloucestershire, Drew finds a huge horse’s head with a dealer specialising in sculptures. And, in Somerset he spots a valuable Persian rug lining a chicken shed.

episodes.name: E11: Episode 11
episodes.overview: In Devon, Drew rummages through a heap of railway items collected over 30 years by a local enthusiast. And, he digs out treasure at a recently-closed glove factory in Yeovil.

episodes.name: E12: Episode 12
episodes.overview: Drew visits an amazing collection of wicker in the Somerset levels and is smitten by an Orkney chair. In Glasgow, he finds an easel that’s a work of art.

episodes.name: E13: Episode 13
episodes.overview: At a Hampshire auction room Drew has the pick of over 500 items from affluent private homes. In Lancaster he’s reminded of his passion for Elvis memorabilia.

episodes.name: E14: Episode 14
episodes.overview: Drew visits a salvage yard in Cheshire containing vintage gym equipment with real muscle. At an antique shop on the south coast, he spots some decorative religious moulds.

episodes.name: E15: Episode 15
episodes.overview: Drew visits a country estate mentioned in the Domesday Book and unearths a cupboard that's been unopened for decades. Plus, he finds a weathervane dating to 1800.

episodes.name: Episode 1
episodes.overview: Drew decides that he needs something different to stand out from the competition. He and Tee head to Italy hoping to find some antiques that his rivals won't be able to match.

episodes.name: Episode 2
episodes.overview: At a giant mid-Wales market, Drew has the pick of over 1000 stalls showcasing world-class pieces. He spies a 200-year-old Windsor chair in the best condition he’s ever seen.

episodes.name: Episode 3
episodes.overview: Drew is on a road trip, travelling to Norfolk, Pembroke and Essex. In Pembroke, he finds an old church that has been converted into an antiques store with a varied selection.

episodes.name: Episode 4
episodes.overview: In a quiet South London suburb, Drew comes face to face with the most extraordinary collection of American automobilia he’s ever seen, including Evel Knievel’s Messerschmitt.

episodes.name: Episode 5
episodes.overview: His hunt for fresh stock takes Drew to the Cotswolds, where he finds a giant stash of Indian and Afghan treasures which have come directly from the subcontinent.

episodes.name: Episode 6
episodes.overview: Drew heads to a huge antiques wholesaler in Exeter, where he finds pile upon pile of affordable gems. Next, it’s on to north London, to visit an emporium of curiosities.

episodes.name: Episode 7
episodes.overview: Drew heads to Devon, where he finds a wealth of unusual oddities housed in a country pub. Next, it’s on to Hastings, which has enjoyed a recent resurgence in the antiques trade.

episodes.name: Episode 8
episodes.overview: Modern day treasure hunter Drew Pritchard travels the length and breadth of the UK in search of weird and wonderful objects. The bigger the hoard, the happier he is.

episodes.name: Episode 9
episodes.overview: Modern day treasure hunter Drew Pritchard travels the length and breadth of the UK in search of weird and wonderful objects. The bigger the hoard, the happier he is.

episodes.name: Episode 10
episodes.overview: In Sussex, Drew has some incredible luck when he is offered first pick of a shop packed full of French items. Then in Kent, he's invited behind the scenes of a historic railway.

episodes.name: Episode 11
episodes.overview: Modern day treasure hunter Drew Pritchard travels the length and breadth of the UK in search of weird and wonderful objects. The bigger the hoard, the happier he is.

episodes.name: Episode 12
episodes.overview: Sensing the chance to get some bargains, Drew Pritchard checks in on some contacts who are downsizing and selling off collections. In Norwich, he finds a beautiful Victorian umbrella stand.

episodes.name: Episode 13
episodes.overview: Drew Pritchard examines furniture in a Black Country factory. Next, in Derby, a new contact pays off when he finds the crankshaft from a Battle of Britain fighter plane.

episodes.name: Episode 14
episodes.overview: In Lancashire, Drew Pritchard visits a sprawling salvage yard that yields many unique items. Next, at an auction house, he faces off against other dealers in a bidding war.

episodes.name: Episode 15
episodes.overview: Drew Pritchard visits some family-run businesses in Lincolnshire and Norfolk in the hope of finding rare and unusual antiques that have never been put on sale before.

episodes.name: Episode 1
episodes.overview: Drew Pritchard and his long-time friend Tee John set out on a tour of France. In Normandy, Drew falls in love with a grand chateau and in a massive antique fair immerses himself in pop culture.

episodes.name: Episode 2
episodes.overview: Drew and Tee are on a tour of the Midlands. In Walsall, they have a money-spinning idea, in Birmingham Drew finds treasure and they explore a grand country house.

episodes.name: Episode 3
episodes.overview: Modern day treasure hunter Drew Pritchard travels the length and breadth of the UK in search of weird and wonderful objects. The bigger the hoard, the happier he is.

episodes.name: Episode 8
episodes.overview: As owner of one of the largest decorative salvage yards in the United Kingdom - Fabulously British Salvage - Drew Pritchard is always looking for new pieces to replenish his shop, and he has no problem scouring the countryside to find them. This series follows Drew all over the country, including some privileged estates, as he hunts for old and forgotten pieces of history. But finding them is only part of the business; Drew must then convince the owner of each item to sell it to him at a fair price, then it's off to the salvage yard, where his team restores it to its original shine before it can be sold for profit.

episodes.name: Episode 9
episodes.overview: Modern day treasure hunter Drew Pritchard travels the length and breadth of the UK in search of weird and wonderful objects.

episodes.name: Episode 10
episodes.overview: Modern day treasure hunter Drew Pritchard travels the length and breadth of the UK in search of weird and wonderful objects.

episodes.name: Episode 11
episodes.overview: Modern day treasure hunter Drew Pritchard travels the length and breadth of the UK in search of weird and wonderful objects.

episodes.name: Episode 13
episodes.overview: Modern day treasure hunter Drew Pritchard travels the length and breadth of the UK in search of weird and wonderful objects.

episodes.name: Episode 14
episodes.overview: Modern day treasure hunter Drew Pritchard travels the length and breadth of the UK in search of weird and wonderful objects.

episodes.name: Episode 15
episodes.overview: Modern day treasure hunter Drew Pritchard travels the length and breadth of the UK in search of weird and wonderful objects.

episodes.name: Episode 16
episodes.overview: Drew and Tee head to Cornwall to visit a brewery in St Austell. Plus, they stop in Penzance and go for a surf in the sea during the southwest adventure.

episodes.name: Episode 17
episodes.overview: In the Cotswolds, Drew Pritchard looks around an impressive manor house. He then visits a converted Chapel in Burnley filled with incredible antiques and a car showroom in Jersey.

episodes.name: Episode 18
episodes.overview: Drew Pritchard visit a shop in Lincolnshire filled with a plethora of valuable treasures. He also stops by at an impressive house in Yorkshire to see whether there is anything for sale.

episodes.name: Episode 19
episodes.overview: Drew Pritchard and Tee scour the British coastline for treasure. On their 280 mile trek from North Wales to the Essex Coast, they uncover a terrific triple sink and a bank of pine drawers.

episodes.name: Episode 20
episodes.overview: Drew Pritchard and Tee head to a salvage yard in Clacton-on-Sea, Essex and unearth a quirky enamel advertising sign. Drew also managers to nab the deal of the Century with a work of art in London.

episodes.name: Episode 21
episodes.overview: Drew Pritchard is thrilled to look through an oddball collection of military antiques in Nantes, France. Plus, he takes an interest in a de Sede sofa bed in the Netherlands.

episodes.name: Episode 22
episodes.overview: In Leeds Drew Pritchard and Tee visit two dealers who have been collecting since 1971. Drew uncovers an old industrial stool and some ceramic hand moulds.

episodes.name: Episode 23
episodes.overview: Drew Pritchard and Tee are excited by the items on offer at the largest antique market in Italy. They also view a fascinating collection in a picturesque town in Spain.

episodes.name: Episode 1
episodes.overview: Drew Pritchard scours sites around the UK for potentially valuable scrap items and forgotten remnants.

episodes.name: Episode 2
episodes.overview: In Gloucestershire, drew uncovers a marble top lamp and a painting of a mackerel. Later, he's thrilled to look around a stately home in Bedfordshire

episodes.name: Episode 3
episodes.overview: Modern day treasure hunter Drew Pritchard travels the length and breadth of the UK in search of weird and wonderful objects. The bigger the hoard, the happier he is.

episodes.name: Episode 4
episodes.overview: Drew Pritchard and Tee view a collection in Boreham Wood, Hertfordshire. Everything is up for sale, including a carved stone saint and marble fireplace supports.

episodes.name: Episode 5
episodes.overview: Drew Pritchard Drew and Tee visit a 500-year-old copper mine in the village of Coniston, Cumbria. They uncover a slipware dairy bowl, pattern wheels and a retail counter.

episodes.name: Episode 6
episodes.overview: Drew Pritchard heads to rural Somerset to rummage through a salvage yard. He tries to buy an industrial ceiling light, a marble column plinth and an antiques sign.

episodes.name: Episode 7
episodes.overview: At a railway museum in Somerset, Drew Pritchard and Tee uncover two rare signs from the 1920s. Later, Drew finds shoe lasts made for music legend Paul McCartney.

episodes.name: Episode 8
episodes.overview: Hunting items with a distinctly French connection, aspiring collector and TV star Fred Sirieix joins Drew Pritchard and Tee John on the road to learn the trade.

episodes.name: Episode 9
episodes.overview: Drew and Tee visit a salvage yard that specialises in stoneware. Blown away by the quality and rarity of some of the items, Drew is forced to haggle hard by the canny dealer.

episodes.name: Episode 10
episodes.overview: Modern day treasure hunter Drew Pritchard visits a heritage railway in Minehead, Somerset, where he finds a fantastic selection of pieces. The highlight of the trip is a ride in the cab of a vintage steam train.

episodes.name: Episode 11
episodes.overview: Modern day treasure hunter Drew Pritchard travels the length and breadth of the UK in search of weird and wonderful objects.

episodes.name: Episode 12
episodes.overview: Drew Pritchard and Tee head to a family run antiques business in Yorkshire with a no-nonsense owner. He has to haggle hard, but Drew bags himself an elegant 19th century bachelor's chest.

episodes.name: Episode 13
episodes.overview: Drew Pritchard and Tee seek out the very best antiques the Isle of Wight has to offer. Their first stop is the seaside town of Ventnor, a fashionable holiday resort in Victorian times.

episodes.name: Episode 14
episodes.overview: Drew Pritchard and Tee visit a grade II listed mansion in Lincolnshire packed with items. Drew haggles for a superb 19th-century chair and a decorated chinoiserie mirror

episodes.name: Episode 15
episodes.overview: Drew Pritchard stops at a salvage yard, which he hails as the best in the country. He and companion Tee find a pair of beautifully crafted sundials and an overthrow believed to be from Belvoir Castle

episodes.name: Episode 1
episodes.overview: Drew and Tee explore a restored castle in the Scottish Lowlands and then up to the Scottish capital of Edinburgh, once known as the Athens of the North, for a bit of antique shopping.

episodes.name: Episode 2
episodes.overview: Drew and Tee plumb for treasures in County Durham.

episodes.name: Episode 3
episodes.overview: Drew accepts a private invitation to one of the grandest stately homes in the country, Palace House. He is stunned by its large collection of electric light fittings and other amazing features.

episodes.name: Episode 4
episodes.overview: On a trip to Sheffield, Drew tries to agree a deal on some incredible industrial pieces. Later, he checks out a collection of unusual hunting artefacts in Ludlow.

episodes.name: Episode 5
episodes.overview: Drew lets the money roll in Newcastle to replenish his stock of Victorian furniture. He then visits a neglected country house where he finds a treasure trove of hidden gems.

episodes.name: Episode 6
episodes.overview: Drew manages to get his hands on an impressive collection of antiques at an 18th century manor. Plus, he checks out a garden filled that is home to more than 200 life-sized sculptures.

episodes.name: Episode 7
episodes.overview: Comedian Johnny Vegas joins Drew on a special salvage road trip. They visit an amazing collection of outsider art in Wigan and a warehouse full of illuminations in Blackpool.

episodes.name: Episode 8
episodes.overview: Modern day treasure hunter Drew Pritchard travels to Spain.

episodes.name: Episode 9
episodes.overview: Modern day treasure hunter Drew Pritchard travels to Stratford and Sheffield.

episodes.name: Episode 10
episodes.overview: Drew buys a 19th century lamp in the Scottish Borders. Later he visits a combined bar and antiques shop in the Ribble Valley.

episodes.name: Episode 11
episodes.overview: Drew visits vintage furniture dealer Morbleu in Lambeth. Later he discovers a rare botanical art book in West Yorkshire.

episodes.name: Episode 12
episodes.overview: Drew gets a exclusive invitation to the estate of a tech tycoon and visits a house clearance in Wolverhampton.

episodes.name: Episode 13
episodes.overview: In the south of England, Drew visits some collectors who specialise in natural objects. And he is not disappointed by their collections.

episodes.name: Episode 14
episodes.overview: In Suffolk, Drew goes on a spending spree when he finds antiques imported from France. Later, in Lancashire, he falls in love with a piece of bamboo furniture.

episodes.name: Episode 15
episodes.overview: Drew picks up a collection of mid-century snout sticks in Suffolk originally used in pig auctions. Next, Drew and Tee spot gothic treasure in a Swansea film studio.

episodes.name: Episode 1
episodes.overview: As the seventeenth series gets underway, Drew and Tee head to the former East Germany, birthplace of early modern design. They visit a fair full of Bauhaus brilliance in Berlin and one of Europe's largest flea markets.

episodes.name: Episode 2
episodes.overview: Big changes are afoot for Drew in Conwy. He hunts for fresh stock in a stunning 1730s Sussex mansion, and in Lincoln he spots an unusual 19th century medical cabinet.

episodes.name: Episode 3
episodes.overview: In Suffolk, Drew spots an architectural wreath that is over 100 years old.

episodes.name: Episode 4
episodes.overview: In Fulham, Drew prepares to spend big with some elite dealers. In Hastings, Drew and Tee unearth some unusual Chinese watercolours and a Turkish rug.

episodes.name: Episode 5
episodes.overview: Modern day treasure hunter Drew Pritchard travels the length and breadth of the UK in search of weird and wonderful objects. The bigger the hoard, the happier he is.

episodes.name: Episode 6
episodes.overview: Drew is joined by his son Tom, who is keen to learn more about the trade. They head to Trinity Marine in Devon, where a Siebe Gorman diving helmet catches the eye.

episodes.name: Episode 7
episodes.overview: Drew bids on an elaborate Victorian mirror and and a stash of Welsh blankets.

episodes.name: Episode 8
episodes.overview: Drew and Tee travel to four extraordinary locations across Northern Italy, including the country's most famed antique markets and a dreamy Tuscan villa

episodes.name: Episode 9
episodes.overview: Drew and Tee go hunting for antiques in the homes of fellow dealers. Tucked away in the Cotswolds, Drew finds an ancient Greek masterpiece from 100 BC.

episodes.name: Episode 10
episodes.overview: Drew encounters thrilling examples by three design titans who shaped the classic Georgian-and-Victorian look: Sir John Soane, Augustus Pugin and William Morris.

episodes.name: Episode 11
episodes.overview: Drew visits a disused fuel shed on a former air force base in Suffolk, where he discovers vases carved from cow bones and a haunting stone face corbel.

episodes.name: Episode 12
episodes.overview: Drew and Tee visit Newark, a town renowned for its antique connections. Drew finds a set of Regency bed steps and a genuine, very rare 18th century mirror

episodes.name: Episode 13
episodes.overview: Drew and Tee visit Insect Circus in Suffolk, they discover a giant pair of 20th Century stage shoes and scratch made models of fairground rides.

episodes.name: Episode 14
episodes.overview: Drew visits a large antique emporium, the largest collection of automobilia in Britain and both the shop and warehouse of a well established dealer. His find include a painting collection, signs, furniture, lighting and a blown glass vase.

episodes.name: Episode 15
episodes.overview: Drew finds a genuine marble bust from the 1860s in Surrey.

episodes.name: Portugal Special
episodes.overview: Drew and Tee take a trip to Portugal, a hidden gem of the antiques trade. They unearth some architectural marvels recovered from an 18th century church.

episodes.name: Every Day is a School Day
episodes.overview: Drew never knows what he might find, who he'll meet, or what he'll learn. He visits an outsider artist with a newly curated art collection.

episodes.name: Different Visions
episodes.overview: Drew meets dealers who see antiques in different ways. He finds a carved lion with a mysterious back-story, and four chairs by his design hero, Pugin.

episodes.name: Shop Local
episodes.overview: Drew seeks out antiques that are rich with local provenance. On the Scottish border, he finds a Georgian Cockpen chair, then snaps up a chilling art piece in North Wales.

episodes.name: Masters of the Trade
episodes.overview: On a trip from Manchester to Hampshire, Drew visits expert dealers, snapping up a campaign chair, a Georgian bookcase, and a 19th-century carved deer

episodes.name: In the Family
episodes.overview: Drew seeks out a combination of knowledge and experience when he visits four family businesses. He discovers an exciting array of items to sell on

episodes.name: Georgian Special
episodes.overview: Drew indulges his Georgian obsession in Lincoln, where he falls for a Regency wine cooler. And a bungalow near Stockport hides a vast collection

episodes.name: Survivors
episodes.overview: Drew finds rare pieces that have stood the test of time. They include an 18th century cabinet in superb original condition and a chest from the Vatican.

episodes.name: Ireland Special
episodes.overview: Exploring Ireland's thriving antiques world, Drew and new buying partner Alister uncover treasures in private homes and showrooms across the country.

episodes.name: Scotland Special
episodes.overview: Drew gets an insider's tour of Scotland with local dealer, Viki Knott. He discovers a Mackintosh-influenced chair and some sinister 1960s Americana.

episodes.name: Different Is Good
episodes.overview: Drew and Alister are on the hunt for exciting stock. They visit a business specializing in the creation of artificial flowers for film and theater.

episodes.name: Treading New Ground
episodes.overview: Treading new ground across the UK, Drew and Viki explore the factory complex of a historic British cloth producer.

episodes.name: Conversation Starters
episodes.overview: Drew and Alister's hunt for pieces with an interesting backstory takes them from Sussex to Shropshire with campaign furniture and quirky collectables.

episodes.name: Favorite Hunting Grounds
episodes.overview: Drew takes fellow dealer Viki to some of the types of hunting ground which have helped to shape his unique take on decorative salvage and antiques.

episodes.name: Nature in Design
episodes.overview: Drew and Alister hunt for pieces inspired by nature, from a folk-art bird's head walking stick in Brighton to a fireside tiger in Shropshire.

episodes.name: Heritage Heroes
episodes.overview: Drew and Al buy from heritage sellers snapping up a curved oak settle made in 1810 and century-old steel tables from a Northampton blacksmith.

episodes.name: Viki's New Shop
episodes.overview: Drew and Viki buy for Viki's new Edinburgh premises and they find deer antlers from a Cumbrian country house and industrial tables from a former tannery.

episodes.name: Curated Collections
episodes.overview: Drew and Al trawl collections curated by experts unearthing a rare item of motoring history and a 19th-century model ship with a tale to tell.
